Transformation Program Manager

Company Name VMware Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 107 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

VMware is a fast pace, rapidly growing environment, and will require flexibility to roll up sleeves to participate in various roles to deliver success! Our Transformation Program Manager will be responsible for working within the Worldwide Professional Services Strategy function to enable new business models, deliver innovative capabilities and process improvement to support VMware’s growing business. This role would need to have a strong understanding of Agile project management practices, having been in positions of managing agile programs. In addition, this key player must be able to drive the overall strategy, planning and execution of key initiatives.

Responsibilities
  • Planning & Strategy
    • Oversee business aspects of program by constructing of project teams, charters, project plans, contingencies, success metrics and ROI measurements
    • Work cross-functionally to establish and manage appropriate team structure for successful delivery across impacted organizations.
  • Project Execution
    • Manage all phases of program to success, including initiation, planning, definition, design, testing and deployment cycles
    • Drive definition of business solution concepts in partnership with IT and business constituents
    • Align program with other VMware initiatives and manage cross project dependencies
    • Recommend and manage the alignment and prioritization of initiatives based on business strategy and simplification to meet key objectives
    • Drive cross functional implementation of policies and procedures
  • Stakeholder/Cross-Functional Team Management
    • Establish a clear RACI around project roles and responsibilities.
    • Manage cross-functional global teams (IT, business, 3rd party vendors, etc.) in a matrix management framework
    • Ensure successful working relationships among project teams
  • Change Management & Communications
    • Facilitate change management and communication planning activities through project lifecycle
    • Drive regular forums to update business communities and steering committee on progress, status and issues
  • Risk/Issue Management
    • Foresee, manage, and raise appropriate visibility to risks and issues.
    • Drive resolution of any conflicts and escalate as needed to avoid roadblocks
  • Governance
    • Help in establishing standards for program management (monitoring and governance) including processes, appropriate project controls, methodologies, metrics, reporting, and tools to ensure the development and use of program/project management

Qualifications & Experience
  • Education/Training
    • Project Management certification or equivalent (preferred)
    • MBA or Masters is a MUST
  • Experience
    • 3+ years project related work experience
    • 2+ years’ experience leading major Programs/Projects in a complex, global corporate setting
    • Project Management and SDLC lifecycle experience, waterfall and agile methodologies
    • Program management consultancy experience is a plus
  • Key Traits
    • Must be a self-starter, motivated individual who works well under pressure
    • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate tasks to meet multiple deadlines
    • Ability to drive collaboration with executives, business and technical teams to achieve effective solutions
    • Outgoing and comfortable building cross-functional relationships
    • Effective communication skills with all levels of management
    • Flexible and resilient, comfortable with ambiguity, adaptable to a high-change environment and open to new concepts and/or processes
    • Conflict resolution and negotiations skills to resolve disagreements quickly and effectively, bringing a problem-solving attitude to conflicting approaches and priorities involving others
    • Ability to think strategically

Seniority Level

  • Computer Software

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 14 views

Job description

About GFG Alliance

Liberty Primary Steel is unique. It’s Australia’s only manufacturer of steel long products, Liberty Primary Steel is as diversified as its footprint. When considering a business that can offer you career progression across a broad and distinct portfolio, consider a career with Liberty Primary Steel. Our expertise in operating as a fully integrated value chain within manufacturing, engineering, marketing, sales and many more stream, enables our employees to explore truly diverse career paths. We can offer employees the opportunities to transition between businesses and broaden their skill-sets; all within the Liberty Primary Steel business. In Liberty Primary Steel you will join a culture that will challenge you to give us an edge, constantly pushing for operational excellence in how we manufacture, sell and deliver. We have careers and opportunities to challenge you.

About The Role

There is currrently some excellent opportunities for reliable and safety-focused electricians to join our dynamic teams across the business in a friendly, community focused environment. These positions are full time permanent day shift positions, with the potential to cover shift relief.

Reporting to the Electrical and Instrument Team Leader, you will work as part of a team to achieve targeted levels of plant availability through planned preventive and corrective maintenance in addition to any skilled response to urgent plant issues as required.

To be successful in this role you will must hold the below criteria:
  • An unrestricted “A Class” electrical licence
  • Ability to work as an active team player as well as independently
  • Be self-motivated, enthusiastic and focused
  • Strong technical and electrical aptitude
  • Experience in fault finding, maintaining equipment and installation.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Be a self-starter with the drive to complete and go beyond any task you are given
  • Demonstrate a personal commitment to safety in the workplace, complying with all company policies, WH&S rules and regulations and hold safety as a core value on our journey to Goal Zero.

Applicants that hold a dual trade (Electrical/Instrumentation), current High Risk Work licences, PLC experience or High Voltage experience will be highly regarded. Experience in an industrial manufacturing environment would be preferred.

Why work for GFG Alliance?

Across our different business units, we offer career opportunities for people who share our drive, passion and ambition. From apprentices and graduates to experienced professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as our business grows. We would love you to be part of our journey.

866709057:
[

Executive Director

Company Name Derwent Executive Company Location Sydney CBD, Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 100 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The Independent Planning Commission is an independent planning body established on 1st March 2018. It operates independently of other Government agencies including the Department of Planning & Environment.


The key functions of the Commission include:

  • The key functions of the Commission include:determination of applications for major development as a consent authority, or under delegation from the Minister.
  • Providing independent expert advice on planning and development related matters.


The Commission plays an important role in strengthening transparency and independence in the decision-making processes for major development and land use planning in NSW. It provides an additional level of scrutiny in the provision of independent expert advice or determination of major development applications.


The Commission is served by the Commission Secretariat. The Secretariat is part of the support the Department of Planning & Environment supplies o the Commission under a Memorandum of Understanding between the two agencies. It comprises a small multidisciplinary team which works closely with the Chair of the Commission, Commission members, various stakeholders and the public.


Primary purpose of the role


Under the general direction of the Commission Chair, the Executive Director heads the Secretariat to the Commission, ensuring provision of the support needed for the Commission to deliver on its statutory responsibilities with a high level of professionalism and in a timely manner.


Please read the role description prior to preparing your application.


To be successful in this role you will be an experienced senior leader with the ability to provide expert high quality support to a high profile independent agency, making decisions that are often contentious.


Essential requirements


Degree qualification in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent relevant experience at a senior management level along with the ability and proven experience in producing high quality reports to tight deadlines.


Our commitment to diversity


We value diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups and those with disability.


Role status


This constitutes ongoing employment under section 34 of the Government Sector Employment Act 2013, and the role is based in Sydney.


Eligibility


To be eligible to apply for ongoing employment within the NSW Department of Planning & Environment, candidates must be an Australian citizen or have the status of permanent residence in Australia.


How to apply


To apply and for a copy of the role description, please go to www.derwentexecutive.com.au and search reference number 24180 or the role title.


Please submit your resume along with a cover letter demonstrating how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role.Refer to the role description for details about the key accountabilities, capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.


Should you require additional information prior to making an application please call Andrew McEncroe on (02) 9091 3230 or email amcencroe@derwentexecutive.com.au


Applications close 11.59 pm Wednesday 17 October

  • Public Policy

[

Senior Technical Consultant

Company Name Virtual Machine Technology (VMtech) Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who are we and what do we do?


Virtual Machine Technology (VMtech) is a leading Secure MultiCloud Service Provider with expertise in delivering best-fit Hybrid Cloud infrastructure with Enterprise Connectivity and Cyber Security. We are passionate about innovation, collaboration and customer service which is reflected in our positive and inclusive work environment. As part of Telstra’s Business Technology Services group we are a rapidly growing and dynamic business on the forefront of technology. Exciting opportunities await!


What's on offer?

Due to an internal transfer wthin our team, an opporutnity has opened up for a Senior Technical Consultant to join our team. As a Senior Consultant, you will provide high quality support services to VMtech’s Managed Services clients, through exceptional communication skills and service excellence. You will possess a strong technical background, superb client management skills and a passion for excellence.


What will you be doing?

  • Focused towards compute and virtualisation technologies supporting multiple VMware environments for VMtech's Managed Service's clients
  • Provide escalation and mentoring support to VSO Frontline for the support of managed service clients through ticket accuracy, real-time monitoring, handling of incidents & proactively managing resolution SLAs
  • Proactive consultancy, root cause analysis and regular maintenance activities across a varied range of technologies including Microsoft, Cisco, Citrix, VMware, Palo Alto Networks, Commvault, Zerto & NetApp
  • Support of solutions based on Microsoft Technologies, VMware, NetApp Unified Storage and Commvault Data Management & Backup solutions
  • Managing incident and support requests according to SLA priorities and VSO dashboards
  • In-depth diagnosis, troubleshooting and remediation of customer tickets
  • Proactively managing our client's IT environments and conduct problem management to ensure the root cause of issues is addressed
  • Solve the complex, high-impact challenges faced by our customers in a timely and efficient manner
  • Be the primary point of contact for escalation and resolution of customer issues and manage escalated issues that front line support is not equipped to handle
  • Liaise with staff and vendors to ensure timely resolution of incidents
  • Monitor, analyse and provide reports on specified network infrastructure.
  • Identifying and improving existing support based process

What will you bring to VMtech?


You will have around 5 years experience in a similar role and wokring within a support team, with demonstrated abiity in fault logging and ticket management. You will be highly customer focussed, with excellent phone manner and communication skills, written and verbal. Lastly, your strong analytical and technical troubleshooting skills plus attention to detail and quality will see you shine in this role.


What can we offer you?

We pride ourselves on the quality of our people, our partnerships and relationships with our clients. Our culture is one of collaboration, high performance and fun which is seen throughout our whole business, within our values and approach to work. Some of our perks include quarterly and annual employee awards, themed Fridays, a social and sports committee, subsidised fitness classes, just to name a few! \xa0VMtech's offices are conveniently located in the heart of the CBD, close to Wynyard station.


As a wholly owned subsidiary of Telstra, our benefits include a 25% discount on Telstra products, staff mobile connect plan and \xa0rewards programme.


It is a great time to be joining our business and as we continue to grow and deliver great results for our customers, you will have a real opportunity to make a huge impact. If you are an ambitious "go getter", enjoy swimming in the "deep end" and looking for an environment of rapid growth and learning, we want to hear from you.


But just don't take out word for it, check out our website www.vmtech.com.au

Contact the job poster

Lisa Grant

People and Culture Manager VMtech
